EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.84}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label TV Shows on the x-axis?

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to TV Shows and Innovation or the cell corresponding to Movies and Preservation?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {TV Shows} and {Innovation} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Movies and Influence or the cell corresponding to Movies and Preservation?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Movies} and {Preservation} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Language and Diversity or the cell corresponding to Literature and Influence?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Literature} and {Influence} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.36 to 0.43?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Language, Accessibility), (Gaming, Adoption), (Fashion, Critique), (Cuisine, Influence), (Cuisine, Innovation), (Cuisine, Localization), (Cuisine, Preservation)}.
